alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 2:08PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Heavy snow will impact portions of Clinton, northeastern Franklin, and Essex Counties in New York and Addison, Grand Isle, western Chittenden, northern Rutland, northwestern Windsor and western Franklin Counties in Vermont through 245 PM EST... At 205 PM EST, rain turning to heavy snow was reported along a line extending from 6 miles north of Churubusco to near Rogers Rock Campground. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds 35 mph or greater, and visibility less than a half mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and will blow around unsecured objects. Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Plattsburgh International Airport, Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Plattsburgh, Middlebury, South Burlington, Vergennes, Essex, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Moriah, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Willsboro, Crown Point and Westport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between mile markers 82 and 175. Interstate 89 between mile markers 81 and 106.
info.instruction: Temperatures are above freezing, but sharply colder temperatures following the snow will cause any water or slush to quickly freeze on roads and sidewalks. Untreated road surfaces will become extremely slippery and offer little or no traction. Reduced speeds and distance between vehicles is advised.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
